mechanisms.title: Dynamical theory for adaptive systems
mechanisms.mechanism: Two-timescale adaptive dynamics where slow parameter evolution controls fast state variable dynamics, with feedback loops selecting for network structures that provide phenotypic robustness under intermediate environmental noise levels

mechanisms.title: When time delays and phase lags are not the same
mechanisms.mechanism: Higher-order phase reduction reveals that time delays create complex delay-dependent synchronization states beyond simple phase lags, enabling bistability between synchronized and desynchronized states

mechanisms.title: Synchronization transitions in phase oscillator populations with partial adaptive coupling
mechanisms.mechanism: Adaptive coupling that responds to order parameter via power-law feedback creates different routes to synchronization - explosive or continuous phase transitions depending on the adaptive weight distribution

mechanisms.title: Focus on the disruption of networks and system dynamics
mechanisms.mechanism: Single node or edge failures trigger cascading failures through network propagation, with failure patterns determined by network topology and the distribution of load/stress across connections

mechanisms.title: Kardar-Parisi-Zhang fluctuations in synchronization dynamics
mechanisms.mechanism: Synchronization dynamics exhibit universal scaling behavior following Kardar-Parisi-Zhang equation with columnar noise, showing Tracy-Widom fluctuation distributions independent of system details

mechanisms.title: Evolutionary game selection creates cooperative environments
mechanisms.mechanism: Coevolution of strategies and games creates feedback where successful strategies reshape the environment to favor cooperation, amplified by network heterogeneity and clustering

mechanisms.title: Order parameter dynamics in complex systems
mechanisms.mechanism: Slow modes emerge as order parameters at phase transitions through slaving principle, where fast modes become enslaved to slow collective variables that determine macroscopic behavior

mechanisms.title: Signatures of criticality in efficient coding networks
mechanisms.mechanism: Networks optimized for efficient information coding naturally operate near criticality, exhibiting scale-free dynamics and crackling noise at the optimal noise level for coding performance

mechanisms.title: Dynamics-Adapted Radiotherapy Dose
mechanisms.mechanism: Adaptive radiation dosing based on tumor evolutionary dynamics uses cell population feedback to optimize treatment timing, exploiting competition between sensitive and resistant populations

mechanisms.title: Cooperation in a non-ergodic world on a network
mechanisms.mechanism: Time-averaging differences between ensemble and temporal means in non-ergodic systems create heterogeneous growth rates that promote cooperation through wealth concentration effects

mechanisms.title: Power-Law Behavior of Biological Networks
mechanisms.mechanism: Metabolic and regulatory networks exhibit power-law degree distributions arising from preferential attachment during evolution, creating hubs that provide robustness against random failures

mechanisms.title: Causal emergence in biological networks
mechanisms.mechanism: Higher-level network descriptions can have greater causal power than microscopic descriptions through coarse-graining that reduces noise while preserving information flow

mechanisms.title: Learning representations for control
mechanisms.mechanism: Representation learning for control tasks discovers low-dimensional manifolds that separate controllable from uncontrollable dynamics, enabling efficient planning in reduced state spaces

mechanisms.title: Evolutionary dynamics on correlated landscapes
mechanisms.mechanism: Fitness landscape correlations create evolutionary highways that channel adaptation along predictable paths, with landscape ruggedness determining the speed-accuracy tradeoff in evolution

mechanisms.title: Collective navigation by signaling
mechanisms.mechanism: Groups achieve collective navigation through local signaling that propagates directional information, with accuracy improving with group size but limited by signal noise accumulation

mechanisms.title: Diversity in evolutionary dynamics
mechanisms.mechanism: Diversity maintenance requires frequency-dependent selection or spatial heterogeneity creating niches, with diversity-stability relationships determined by interaction network structure

mechanisms.title: Multi-scale feedback in adaptive networks
mechanisms.mechanism: Feedback loops operating at multiple timescales create hierarchical control where slow variables set constraints for fast dynamics while being shaped by time-averaged fast behavior

mechanisms.title: Energy landscape of neural computation
mechanisms.mechanism: Neural computation follows energy landscapes where attractor states represent memories or computational outcomes, with noise enabling transitions between basins for flexible computation

mechanisms.title: Information bottleneck in biological sensing
mechanisms.mechanism: Biological sensors optimize mutual information between input and output subject to metabolic constraints, creating information bottlenecks that filter relevant from irrelevant variation

mechanisms.title: Phase separation in active systems
mechanisms.mechanism: Active matter undergoes motility-induced phase separation where self-propelled particles spontaneously separate into dense and dilute phases without attractive interactions

quality_assessment.mechanism_quality: High - all mechanisms describe structural, causal relationships
quality_assessment.domain_neutrality: Excellent - mechanisms abstracted from specific implementations
quality_assessment.cross_domain_applicability: Strong - mechanisms span physics, biology, computation, social systems
quality_assessment.comparison_with_arxiv: Comparable quality, potentially higher mechanism density
